citeinfo.title: Rivers_NRI_NPS_IN: Nationwide Rivers Inventory for Indiana (U.S. National Park Service, 1:100,000, Line Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This information was obtained by personnel of Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates, Inc., (BLA) from the Web site of the Indiana Segments of the Nationawide Rivers Inventory published by the U.S. National Park Service at - http://www.nps.gov/ncrc/programs/rtca/nri/states/in.html. The information was last updated in November 2004.

descript.abstract:
Dataset includes all Indiana river reaches on the Nationwide Rivers Inventory (NRI) listed by the U.S. National Park Service (NPS). The file was created using 1:100,000 scale data from the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD), therefore, the lines remain in the NHD reaches, resulting in multiple line segments for each NRI listing. The line segments have NOT been dissolved. The start and end point of each listing segment is approximate and located by described landmarks.
The following excerpt from the NPS, NRI website describes the eligibility for a river to be listed-
In order to be listed on the NRI, a river must be free-flowing and possess one or more Outstandingly Remarkable Values (ORVs). Thus, the eligibility analysis consists of an examination of the river's hydrology, including any man-made alterations, and an inventory of its natural, cultural, and recreational resources. There are a variety of methods to determine whether certain resources are so unique, rare or exemplary as to make them outstandingly remarkable. The determination that a river area contains ORVs is a professional judgment on the part of the interdisciplinary study team (IDT), based on objective, scientific analysis. Input from organizations and individuals familiar with specific river resources should be sought and documented as part of the process. In order to be assessed as outstandingly remarkable, a river-related value must be a unique, rare, or exemplary feature that is significant at a comparative regional or national scale. Dictionary definitions of the words "unique" and "rare" indicate that such a value would be one that is conspicuous example from among a number of similar values that are themselves uncommon or extraordinary. Only one such value is needed for eligibility.”
descript.purpose: These data were developed to provide the Indiana subset of the Nationwide Rivers Inventory as a GIS layer.
descript.supplinf: Digital data creation done by BLA is fully disclosed in the process steps of this metadata; credit for the information is retained by the U.S. National Park Service (NPS).

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 765 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Accuracy is determined by the source website listing the classifications, outstanding river values (ORVs), and descriptions of each NRI river. Two exceptions include: (1) Two records for the Little Blue River which appear to encompass the same stretches of river. The attributes of these two records were combined and represented here as a single record. (2) One record of the Wabash River does not have any outstanding values recorded in the original data. This is a known error because all listed rivers must have at least one ORV. It is suspected by the comments to be outstanding for fishing, recreation, and history, but in order to be true to the source, assumptions are not made and the fields are left blank.

dataqual.logic: Data are consistent with the 1:100,000 National Hydrography Dataset (NHD). There are no known overlaps or line gaps. Each line segment ends at intersections. Lines remain in the individual reaches consistent with the NHD and have not been dissolved to reflect singular NRI listings.
dataqual.complete: All Stream segments in the NPS List of Nationwide Rivers Inventory (NRI) and are included. Stream segments begin and end as closely to the described limits as the data compiler could determine.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal position is dependent on the accuracy of the national hydrography dataset (1:100,000).

srcinfo.srccontr: All base information to identify river segments and complete attributes.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency
citeinfo.title: HYDROGRAPHY_LINE_NHD_IN: Streams, Rivers, Canals, and Ditches in Indiana (United States Geological Survey, 1:100000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: Data are from the 2002 NHD data set downloadable from, http://nhd.usgs.gov/index.html

procstep.procdesc: National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) was copied for use as the base line file. The Nationwide Rivers Inventory for Indiana segments was used to identify all listed river/stream segments. New attribute fields were added to provide classification categories, outstanding river values (ORVs) and descriptions.
procstep.srcused: Indiana subset of NRI Web site, HYDROGRAPHY_LINE_NHD_IN.SHP

procstep.procdesc: Initial work described in the previous process step was reviewed and sources were checked for currentness. No updates were identified

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

attrdomv.udom: Numeric Field

attr.attrdef: Potential “Wild River” Classification - Those rivers or sections of rivers that are free of impoundments and generally inaccessible except by trail, with watersheds or shorelines essentially primitive and waters unpolluted. These represent vestiges of primitive America.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Potential “Scenic River” Classification - Those rivers or sections of rivers that are free of impoundments, with shorelines or watersheds still largely primitive and shorelines largely undeveloped, but accessible in places by roads.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Potential “Recreational River” Classification – Those rivers or sections of rivers that are readily accessible by road or railroad, that may have some development along their shorelines, and that may have undergone some impoundment or diversion in the past.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Scenery - The landscape elements of landform, vegetation, water, color, and related factors result in notable or exemplary visual features and/or attractions. When analyzing scenic values, additional factors -- such as seasonal variations in vegetation, scale of cultural modifications, and the length of time negative intrusions are viewed -- may be considered. Scenery and visual attractions may be highly diverse over the majority of the river or river segment.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Recreation - Recreational opportunities are, or have the potential to be, popular enough to attract visitors from throughout or beyond the region of comparison or are unique or rare within the region. Visitors are willing to travel long distances to use the river resources for recreational purposes. River-related opportunities could include, but are not limited to, sightseeing, wildlife observation, camping, photography, hiking, fishing and boating. (1) Interpretive opportunities may be exceptional and attract, or have the potential to attract, visitors from outside the region of comparison. (2)The river may provide, or have the potential to provide, settings for national or regional usage or competitive events.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Geology - The river, or the area within the river corridor, contains one or more example of a geologic feature, process or phenomenon that is unique or rare within the region of comparison. The feature(s) may be in an unusually active stage of development, represent a "textbook" example, and/or represent a unique or rare combination of geologic features (erosional, volcanic, glacial, or other geologic structures).

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Fish - Fish values may be judged on the relative merits of either fish populations, habitat, or a combination of these river-related conditions. (1) Populations- The river is nationally or regionally an important producer of resident and/or anadromous fish species. Of particular significance is the presence of wild stocks and/or federal or state listed (or candidate) threatened, endangered or sensitive species. Diversity of species is an important consideration and could, in itself, lead to a determination of "outstandingly remarkable." (2) Habitat- The river provides exceptionally high quality habitat for fish species indigenous to the region of comparison. Of particular significance is habitat for wild stocks and/or federal or state listed (or candidate) threatened, endangered or sensitive species. Diversity of habitats is an important consideration and could, in itself, lead to a determination of "outstandingly remarkable."

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Wildlife - values may be judged on the merits of either terrestrial or aquatic wildlife populations or habitat or a combination of these conditions. (1) Populations- The river, or area within the river corridor, contains nationally or regionally important populations of indigenous wildlife species. Of particular significance are species considered to be unique, and/or populations of federal or state listed (or candidate) threatened, endangered or sensitive species. Diversity of species is an important consideration and could, in itself, lead to a determination of "outstandingly remarkable." (2) Habitat- The river, or area within the river corridor, provides exceptionally high quality habitat for wildlife of national or regional significance, and/or may provide unique habitat or a critical link in habitat conditions for federal or state listed (or candidate) threatened, endangered or sensitive species. Contiguous habitat conditions are such that the biological needs of the species are met. Diversity of habitats is an important consideration and could, in itself, lead to a determination of "outstandingly remarkable."

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Prehistory - The river, or area within the river corridor, contains a site(s) where there is evidence of occupation or use by Native Americans. Sites must have unique or rare characteristics or exceptional human interest value(s). Sites may have national or regional importance for interpreting prehistory; may be rare and represent an area where a culture or cultural period was first identified and described; may have been used concurrently by two or more cultural groups; and/or may have been used by cultural groups for rare sacred purposes. Many such sites are listed on the National Register of Historic Places, which is administered by the NPS.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: History - The river or area within the river corridor contains a site(s) or feature(s) associated with a significant event, an important person, or a cultural activity of the past that was rare or one-of-a-kind in the region. Many such sites are listed on the National Register of Historic Places. A historic site(s) and/or features(s) is 50 years old or older in most cases.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Culture - The river or area within the river corridor contains archaeological sites or areas significant to traditional cultures. Examples might be American Indian burial grounds, petroglyphs, the oldest known human use site in a region, or streams that support traditional agriculture, subsistence fishing, or religious ceremonies.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: Other - While no specific national evaluation guidelines have been developed for the "other similar values" category, assessments of additional river-related values consistent with the foregoing guidance may be developed -- including, but not limited to, hydrology, paleontology and botany resources.

attrdomv.udom: Y indicates this classification is listed as an ORV for the record.

attr.attrdef: River descriptions provided in the NRI listings

attrdomv.udom: river descriptions

distinfo.distliab:
No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data.
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates, Inc., is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
